meanings.definition: Throw (something) forcefully in a specified direction.
meanings.sent1: He casts the ball to his friend during the game.
meanings.sent2: She casts her fishing line into the lake to catch a fish.
meanings.sent3: The magician casts a spell on the audience, making them gasp in amazement.
meanings.sent4: The storm casts dark clouds over the city, signaling heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor carefully casts the molten metal into a beautiful sculpture.

meanings.definition: An object made by shaping metal or other material in a mold.
meanings.sent1: The artist displayed her intricate metal casts at the gallery.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist found ancient casts of tools used by early humans.
meanings.sent3: The child used sand to make casts of different shapes on the beach.
meanings.sent4: The museum showcased casts of famous statues from around the world.
meanings.sent5: The jeweler created unique casts of rings using precious metals.

meanings.definition: The actors taking part in a play, movie, or other production.
meanings.sent1: The casts of the new movie include famous Hollywood actors.
meanings.sent2: The theater director held auditions to select the casts for the upcoming play.
meanings.sent3: During the rehearsal, the casts of the play had a fun dance-off.
meanings.sent4: The casts of the TV show worked together to create a memorable episode.
meanings.sent5: The casts of the musical received a standing ovation for their outstanding performance.
